dismissalText.long: c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad
dismissalText.commentary: Innocent Kaia c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad 63 (74b 6x4 1x6) SR: 85.13

dismissalComment.html: and there's the wicket they were wanting! Short ball outside the off stump. Kaia reveals his thought process quite early by coming down the track. Fareed notices this and drops it short. The batter wants to still go through with the stroke and all that he manages is an edge back to the keeper. It was a top edge and was climbing onto the keeper. He does well to leap and take the catch. They were looking to accelerate when they have already got 7 runs off the over. That's a set batter gone

image.caption: Shumba player portrait
image.longCaption: Shumba player portrait

dismissalComment.html: it hasn't been given out and the captain of Afghanistan goes for a review with a lot of hesitation. Hasn't overstepped. Pitched fuller in line with the stumps. There is no spike on ultraedge as it passes the bat. The ball tracking shows that it was hitting the stumps. Wrong on his part to play on the backfoot to a fuller delivery. The innings is falling off the tracks now with two quick wickets

dismissalComment.html: and has the wicket with the change of angle! Short of a good length delivery wide outside the off stump. He makes room and cuts it straight into the hands of the short third-man fielder standing at the edge of the circle. Zimbabwe have slipped from a position of strength. Will they play out the 50-overs ?

dismissalComment.html: fuller, looped up delivery outside the off stump. Chatara's eyes lit up as he saw the delivery. He wanted to go the aerial route to get off the mark. He was beaten in the air as the ball dipped down on him as he played the stroke. Simple catch to the fielder at extra cover

dismissalText.commentary: Tanaka Chivanga run out (Rashid Khan/Azmatullah Omarzai) 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: short and wide outside the off stump. He looks to slog it and is beaten. Chivanga runs across and a poor throw by the keeper makes the single easy and they get the chance to take the overthrow. It would've been a couple had it not been for an error by Chivanga at the bowler's end. He fails to ground the bat as he running. The bowler collects the throw and whips the bails off the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah c Chakabva b Tiripano 87 (112b 9x4 0x6) SR: 77.67

dismissalComment.html: and Rahmat Shah won't get to a century today as well! Short and wide outside the off stump. Rahmat chases the delivery and gets an outside edge back to the keeper. There is a small ray of hope as they check for the no ball but it's found that he has little part of his foot behind the line and that's enough. Good batting through the innings but a rare moment of indiscretion by Rahmat

Good batting through the innings but a rare moment of indiscretion by Rahmat

commentTextItems.html: makes room and slogs it to mid on for a single and go 2-0 up in the series!

commentPostTextItems.html: Thanks for your company today and please do join for the final game of the series. Till then, good night from all of us here

Ibrahim Zadran is the Player of the match: The wicket was much better for batting today and I decided that I would play my natural game. I really enjoy batting with Rahmat Shah. I can play my shots with him around me.

Hashmatullah Shahidi, Afghanistan captain: The team is playing very well and I am very happy with that. We are trying to get 30 points from this series. We got 20 points. If we get 10 more we can move to the second position in the table

Craig Ervine, Zimbabwe captain: We know that the conditions become better in the afternoon session. We got starts but couldn't kick on. We knew that 260-270 was going to be par. We knew that facing the new ball would be a challenge. A match can change in 5 overs, we have shown that today

Zimbabwe would've noticed how the Afghanistan batters went about their job. The middle-order batters of Zimbabwe, all of them, got a start but couldn't quite kick on. While Ryan Burl got a half-century, it was in the company of the last two batters. He could've probably done better with one of the batters from the middle-order

Afghanistan, through the partnership of Ibrahim Zadran and Rahmat Shah, show to Zimbabwe what might have been! Though they were a wicket down, Ibrahim Zadran went after the bowlers in the powerplay. While Rahmat Shah settled in, Ibrahim Zadran was the aggressor and when Ibrahim Zadran slowed down a touch in sight of a milestone, Rahmat Shah attacked the bowlers. Rahmat Shah got within touching distance of a century, but fell before getting one, like in the first game
Farhad: "Might be Afghanistan's first ever inning without a SIX "This is the list of their innings wihout a six, Farhad

commentTextItems.html: comes forward and dabs it to short third-man fielder
pushes it to the off side and sets off for a single
short ball on the stumps. He rocks back and pulls it behind square for another boundary. Just a stroke away from a win now

dismissalText.commentary: Innocent Kaia c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad 63 (74b 6x4 1x6) SR: 85.13

dismissalComment.html: and there's the wicket they were wanting! Short ball outside the off stump. Kaia reveals his thought process quite early by coming down the track. Fareed notices this and drops it short. The batter wants to still go through with the stroke and all that he manages is an edge back to the keeper. It was a top edge and was climbing onto the keeper. He does well to leap and take the catch. They were looking to accelerate when they have already got 7 runs off the over. That's a set batter gone

dismissalText.commentary: Milton Shumba lbw b Fareed Ahmad 1 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: it hasn't been given out and the captain of Afghanistan goes for a review with a lot of hesitation. Hasn't overstepped. Pitched fuller in line with the stumps. There is no spike on ultraedge as it passes the bat. The ball tracking shows that it was hitting the stumps. Wrong on his part to play on the backfoot to a fuller delivery. The innings is falling off the tracks now with two quick wickets

dismissalText.long: c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad
dismissalText.commentary: Innocent Kaia c Rahmanullah Gurbaz b Fareed Ahmad 63 (74b 6x4 1x6) SR: 85.13

dismissalComment.html: and there's the wicket they were wanting! Short ball outside the off stump. Kaia reveals his thought process quite early by coming down the track. Fareed notices this and drops it short. The batter wants to still go through with the stroke and all that he manages is an edge back to the keeper. It was a top edge and was climbing onto the keeper. He does well to leap and take the catch. They were looking to accelerate when they have already got 7 runs off the over. That's a set batter gone

dismissalText.commentary: Milton Shumba lbw b Fareed Ahmad 1 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: it hasn't been given out and the captain of Afghanistan goes for a review with a lot of hesitation. Hasn't overstepped. Pitched fuller in line with the stumps. There is no spike on ultraedge as it passes the bat. The ball tracking shows that it was hitting the stumps. Wrong on his part to play on the backfoot to a fuller delivery. The innings is falling off the tracks now with two quick wickets

dismissalText.long: c Rahmat Shah b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Rahmat Shah b Mohammad Nabi 40 (57b 2x4 1x6) SR: 70.17

dismissalComment.html: and has the wicket with the change of angle! Short of a good length delivery wide outside the off stump. He makes room and cuts it straight into the hands of the short third-man fielder standing at the edge of the circle. Zimbabwe have slipped from a position of strength. Will they play out the 50-overs ?

dismissalText.commentary: Tanaka Chivanga run out (Rashid Khan/Azmatullah Omarzai) 1 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: short and wide outside the off stump. He looks to slog it and is beaten. Chivanga runs across and a poor throw by the keeper makes the single easy and they get the chance to take the overthrow. It would've been a couple had it not been for an error by Chivanga at the bowler's end. He fails to ground the bat as he running. The bowler collects the throw and whips the bails off the stumps

dismissalComment.html: and Rahmat Shah won't get to a century today as well! Short and wide outside the off stump. Rahmat chases the delivery and gets an outside edge back to the keeper. There is a small ray of hope as they check for the no ball but it's found that he has little part of his foot behind the line and that's enough. Good batting through the innings but a rare moment of indiscretion by Rahmat

milestones.description: Rahmat Shah has become the top scorer for AFG in ODIs with 2934 runs, going past Mohammad Nabi's 2879

stories.title: Bowlers, Ibrahim Zadran, Rahmat Shah help Afghanistan seal ODI series
stories.seoTitle: ZIM vs AFG 2022 - 2nd ODI - Bowlers, Ibrahim Zadran, Rahmat Shah help Afghanistan seal series against Zimbabwe
stories.summary: Ibrahim, Rahmat added a record 195 for the second wicket after left-armers Fareed, Farooqi shared five wickets
